question: A 426-metre ‘Cable Stayed Bridge’ has been constructed across Durgam Cheruvu Lake in which state?
explanation:
A new ‘Cable Stayed Bridge’ has been inaugurated across Durgam Cheruvu Lake, in the state of Andhra Pradesh.
Minister of State for Home G. Kishan Reddy inaugurated the new bridge, which is 426 metres long and 25.8 metre wide. It also has a total of 52 stay cables and is said to be one of the longest in the country constructed at a cost of over Rs.334 crores.
